intro: Gardenia jamaicensis, commonly known as the Jamaican gardenia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is valued for its ornamental beauty. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
